company_context: Clerq provides a modern, bilingual POS system with sleek hardware and simple software, built for Canadian small businesses with full tax compliance, bilingual interface and guaranteed customer support. They primarily target small, independent restaurants and retailers in Canada.

top_leads.title: Michel Falcon - Founder, CEO - Brasa Peruvian Kitchen
top_leads.content: I'm a restaurant entrepreneur building Brasa Peruvian Kitchen; a fast-casual concept I started in Toronto, Canada.
top_leads.reasoning: Founder/CEO of a Canadian fast-casual restaurant concept in Toronto. Perfect geographic and industry fit. As the CEO, strong decision-making authority for POS purchases. He would directly benefit from a modern, bilingual, compliant POS solution for his expanding business.

top_leads.title: Adam Teolis - Restaurant Owner and Entrepreneur
top_leads.content: Restaurant Owner and Entrepreneur, Toronto, Ontario, Canada. Restaurant Owner at Amano Trattoria (Jan 2022 - Present).
top_leads.reasoning: Independent restaurant owner in Toronto. Matches Canadian market and independent SMB criteria. Personally directs purchasing/operational needs and would decide on or influence POS decisions.

top_leads.title: Marco Fiorillo - Restaurant Owner
top_leads.content: Restaurant Owner, Mississauga, ON (La Locanda Italiana Ltd). Over 6 years ownership experience. Focused on growth, marketing, administration, profitability.
top_leads.reasoning: Owner of small independent restaurant in Mississauga. Fits target precisely for industry, size, region. Full authority on purchase decisions and would highly benefit from a customer-oriented, compliant POS.

top_leads.title: Christophe Perreault - Le Club HEC Montréal
top_leads.content: Co-Owner & Retail General Manager at Le Club, Montréal, Quebec. Strong retail/e-commerce business background. Experience spans sales to marketing.
top_leads.reasoning: Co-owner/GM of independent retail business in Montréal. Has budget/purchasing power and technical understanding to evaluate POS. Bilingual and based in Quebec—bilingual/tax compliance features directly relevant.

top_leads.title: Juan Velazquez - Co-Owner at Hacienda Santa Teresa
top_leads.content: First time restaurant owner who specializes in organic, influencer and social media marketing to create an audience.
top_leads.reasoning: Co-owner/decision maker for a small, likely locally-run restaurant in Canada. As an owner, will be primary evaluator and purchaser of POS solutions.

top_leads.title: Michael Noble - Chef/Proprietor at The Nash Restaurant & Off Cut Bar
top_leads.content: Chef/Proprietor at The Nash Restaurant & Off Cut Bar in Calgary. Deep experience in both small and large hospitality operations, owner for a decade+.
top_leads.reasoning: Chef/proprietor of well-known local restaurant in Calgary. Full purchase authority and direct interest in tech to streamline operations and enhance customer/staff experience.

top_leads.title: Christopher Spataro - Co-Owner at Salto Restaurant & Bar
top_leads.content: Co-owner at Salto Restaurant & Bar, Toronto. Young SMB entrepreneur, actively growing the business, responsible for events and operations.
top_leads.reasoning: Co-owner of an independent restaurant with direct purchasing influence. Toronto location, clear operational involvement, likely to care about bilingual support and ease of use.

top_leads.title: Timothy Yu - Founder at Kilslaay Restaurant Group
top_leads.content: Founder at Kilslaay Restaurant Group (Vancouver), operates multiple small restaurants/cafes. MBA with strong strategic/business background.
top_leads.reasoning: Founder of a group of independent, SMB restaurants/cafés in Vancouver. High level strategy and operational decision maker, fits both industry/market and buyer profile.

top_leads.title: Stephane Sauve - co-owner at Paradiso Restaurants
top_leads.content: Co-owner at Paradiso Restaurants. Based in Milton, Ontario, focused on independent restaurant business.
top_leads.reasoning: Co-owner, small independent restaurant in Ontario. Key buyer and end-user of POS. Aligns on geography, company size/type, and business need.

top_leads.title: Brianna M.Foster - Co-Owner of The Porch Restaurant
top_leads.content: Co-Owner of The Porch Restaurant, Cobourg, Ontario. Small, local, independent restaurant owner/manager with direct purchasing authority.
top_leads.reasoning: Co-owner/operator of small, independent restaurant in Ontario, responsible for operational and purchasing decisions. Ideal for Clerq's target market and feature set.

selection_criteria: Target Market Alignment: Canadian, independent owners of small restaurants or retail establishments, with explicit mention of location and company size.
Decision-Making Authority: Owner, founder, CEO, or co-owner status assuring primary purchasing power on POS technology.
Role Relevance: Clear operational/management involvement and likely to directly benefit from POS upgrade.
Profile Quality: Complete, up-to-date profiles with adequate professional detail and engagement.
outreach_recommendations: Personalize messaging to reference their local business/restaurant and highlight Clerq’s Canadian, bilingual, and tax-compliant features.
Acknowledge their entrepreneurial leadership and the challenges of running a modern SMB—frame Clerq as a partner that understands local needs.
Offer a hands-on, demo invitation and a conversation about streamlining their current operations (emphasizing simplicity and dedicated Canadian support).
Reference any experience/expansion in their background and position Clerq as a scalable partner as they grow.
Highlight Clerq’s guaranteed support as a differentiator vs. generic or foreign POS solutions.
